intro: Verbascum jordanovii, commonly known as Jordan's mullein, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It is adapted to dry and sandy soils, often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
